title: my Robot assistant OpenAI with raspberry pi and esp for cute face robot :3
summary: Building a cute robot assistant using OpenAI, Raspberry Pi, and ESP modules.
contentPart1: This project integrates the high-level processing of the Raspberry Pi for interacting with the OpenAI API, allowing the robot to understand complex voice commands and generate natural responses.
contentPart2: The ESP module acts as the microcontroller for the physical parts, managing the servo motors for expressive 'cute face' movements and handling low-latency tasks.

title: Basic Restful API with Django
summary: Learn how to create a basic RESTful API using Django and Django REST framework.
contentPart1: Django REST Framework (DRF) simplifies API development greatly. The essential steps involve defining models, creating serializers to convert model instances to JSON format, and setting up viewsets or function-based views to handle HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).
contentPart2: Authentication and permission classes are crucial for securing your endpoints, ensuring only authorized users can access sensitive data or perform destructive actions.

title: how do start project with react js? why it is so popular among developers?
summary: A beginner's guide to starting a project with React.js and understanding its popularity.
contentPart1: React's popularity stems from its component-based architecture and the Virtual DOM, which provides efficient rendering and predictable state management. Starting a project usually involves 'create-react-app' or tools like Vite/Next.js.
contentPart2: The component structure encourages modularity, making large codebases easier to maintain and scale across development teams.

title: i learn embedded system, web and mobile development, cloud configuration, machine learning but why do i choose software testing?
summary: A personal reflection on why I chose a career in software testing despite my background in other tech fields.
contentPart1: My diverse background provided a unique perspective: knowing how systems are built across different domains (embedded, cloud, web) enhances my ability to find complex failure points and design comprehensive test strategies.
contentPart2: Software testing, especially QA, is the intersection of analytical thinking, quality advocacy, and technical expertise—a perfect fit for leveraging my multidisciplinary skills.

title: what is software testing? and why is it important?
summary: An introduction to software testing and its significance in the software development lifecycle.
contentPart1: Software testing is the process of evaluating a software product to determine if it meets the specified requirements and to identify defects. It’s crucial for minimizing risk, saving costs, and ensuring user satisfaction.
contentPart2: The importance lies in delivering a reliable, high-quality product. Failing to test properly can lead to disastrous consequences, from financial loss to reputational damage.

title: what is API testing?
summary: An introduction to API testing and its role in ensuring software quality.
contentPart1: API (Application Programming Interface) testing involves testing business logic and data layer directly without a UI. It is highly efficient for finding core functionality and security flaws early.
contentPart2: Unlike UI testing, API testing ensures the underlying services are robust and secure, regardless of how the frontend is built.

title: how to use postman for API testing?
summary: A beginner's guide to using Postman for effective API testing.
contentPart1: Postman is an indispensable tool for API testing. It allows you to quickly create requests (GET, POST, etc.), organize them into collections, and test response validations using built-in assertion scripts (tests).
contentPart2: The key feature is using environment variables to manage different endpoints (dev, staging, prod) without changing the core request structure.

title: how do i automated my API testing using postman and newman?
summary: A guide on automating API testing using Postman and Newman for efficient testing workflows.
contentPart1: Newman is a command-line collection runner for Postman. By exporting your Postman collection, Newman can run your entire test suite from the terminal, making it perfect for integration into CI/CD pipelines.
contentPart2: Automation allows continuous validation of the API layer after every code commit, drastically improving the speed and reliability of the development cycle.
